title: There's a Bully in My Brain
features: Justin constantly feels worried and afraid to try new things until he realizes that a bully is living in his brain! He has the choice to allow his bully to continue to scare him, or finally stand up to it and face his fears.
Written by a licensed clinical social worker and child therapist with over 15 years of experience supporting children with anxiety disorders,
There's a Bully In My Brain
helps teach children to recognize warning signs and simple exercises they can use to overcome anxiety.
description: Kristin O'Rourke is a licensed clinical social worker, child therapist, and parenting consultant with over fifteen years of experience supporting children with anxiety disorders and behavioral issues. She owns In-Home LCSW, PLLC, a private group practice which offers home and office-based counseling services for children, women, and families in Rockland and Westchester counties in New York and Bergen County in New Jersey. Kristin's passion is to empower children and their families to reach their fullest potential and to help them understand that the key to happiness lies within them. This is Kristin's first published children's book and she looks forward to writing many more! You can find her on her website at inhomelcsw.com, on Facebook at facebook.com/inhomelcsw, and on Instagram at @inhomelcsw.
